creditline: Gift of James F. and Louise H. Bell in memory of James S. and Sallie M. Bell
description: Portrait of Mrs. Gardner Greene. Half-length portrait, three-quarters life size, of lady, with rose-colored bodice and flaring sleeves. White fichu. Dark hair drawn back from forehead and worn low on neck. Inner oval, broken at bottom, frames portrait.
text: Although Jeremiah Theus is primarily known as a portrait painter, he began his career in Charleston, South Carolina in about 1740, advertising that he painted landscapes and coats of arms. He offered painting classes to both ladies and gentlemen in Charleston in 1744 as well as providing their likenesses.
title: Portrait of Mrs. Gardner Greene
